channel.title: Editing A Client - To stop the questions
channel.description:
[b][center][size=30pt]Editing a Client[/size][/center]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [size=12pt][b]Difficulty -[/b][/size] 1/10 [b]Any noob can do this.[/b] [size=12pt][b]Assumed Knowledge -[/b][/size] [b]Using paint, typing, clicking..[/b] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [center][size=15pt]Explanation[/size][/center] I got [b]really bored[/b] (Sound familiar??), and I haven't made my own topic in a while, So I figured I'd make one, and on Making a Client which is reallly reallly simple, But I've seen alot of people ask about it, So here it is, [i]To stop the questions[/i], XD.. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[center][size=30pt]Getting Started[/size][/center]
[size=11pt][b]First Step[/b] -•-[/size] The thing your going to [i]wan't[/i] to do first is find a Client Source, There are many out there but the one I have is Project Satans, (Awesome) , Client.
Which you can find at this download link I have provided you with.. [url=http://rapidshare.com/files/20874070/Project_Satan_Client.rar.html]Click me to Download[/url]
[size=11pt][b]Second Step[/b] -•-[/size] Alright, Now after you have done that we need to extract those files to a new folder, Name it something like "Yourservername Client" , Like so.
[center][IMG]http://i247.photobucket.com/albums/gg146/Fantasykik/Defaeet.jpg[/img][/center]
[size=11pt][b]Third Step[/b] -•-[/size] Okay, Now after you have extracted it to "Yourservername Client" Folder, You need to open it up.
[center][IMG]http://i247.photobucket.com/albums/gg146/Fantasykik/Serverclient.jpg[/img][/center]
[center][IMG]http://i247.photobucket.com/albums/gg146/Fantasykik/Youras.jpg[/img][/center]
Then all you have to do is take your renamed "YourservernameClient" Into the folder we made on the desktop.
[size=11pt][b]Fourth Step[/b] -•-[/size] Now what were going to do is make a backround picture for your Client, which we can do using [b]Paint[/b].
So open up paint, Then click "File" and then you click "Open" And find the picture you wan't to use as the backround of your client. What Im using is a Trigun Picture, and what we want to do is get the demensions 766 by 503.
[center][IMG]http://i247.photobucket.com/albums/gg146/Fantasykik/4344.jpg[/img][/center]
Then when we have it on paint, we need to get right in the middle of the picture (But first you need to click the cut option),(Middle is where the [b]middle[/b] blue dot is), And cut from the middle to the top right hand corner, let go of mouse, Right click and then click "Flip/rotate" and then click "okay"
(Note: If you wan't to put any text on your client backround picture i suggest you download GIMP, Which can be found [url=http://www.gimp.org/downloads/]Here[/url])
[center][IMG]http://i247.photobucket.com/albums/gg146/Fantasykik/fffe.jpg[/img][/center]
And this is what it should look like as a result of doing what I just showed you..
[center][IMG]http://i247.photobucket.com/albums/gg146/Fantasykik/afdas.jpg[/img] [/center]
Now it might look funny, But thats okay...
[size=11pt][b]Fifth Step[/b] -•-[/size] Now what were going to do is save in your ServernameClient folder, which is were all the classes are, etc. Like so..
[center][IMG]http://i247.photobucket.com/albums/gg146/Fantasykik/gwo.jpg[/img][/center]
Remember to save it as [b].jpg[/b]
[size=11pt][b]Sixth Step[/b] -•-[/size] Now we need to figure out how to edit the backround picture of the client, So what were going to do is find this, [b]Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1[/b].
Open it, And when you have CTRL F this.. "[b].getImage[/b]"
and when you have done that you should find something like this..
[code] Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("satan.jpg");[/code]
and in the code where you see [b]("satan.jpg");[/b] replace that with what you saved, and mine is just asdf so it should look like this..
Example.
[code] Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("asdf.jpg");[/code]
Then what you need to do is go to your compiler that is inside it, and type in "C", when its done, Exit. Then double click "Project Satan Client"
And this is what it looks like, ("What mine looks like anyway..")
[center][IMG]http://i247.photobucket.com/albums/gg146/Fantasykik/WOWWW.jpg[/img][/center]
Doesn't that look awesome..
Now if your wondering how to edit the text, (In Project Satan), There is a "Client.java" inside of it, Just search the text you wan't to change and then compile, run it, and walla.
To get it to work, You have to open your server folder, and Runserver.bat, Go back to client, Type in IP, Username, password.
If you have trouble with the compiler, PM me and ill give you one, Because when i tryed to add one in code, This message exceeded the 20k limit XD.
If you can, Post your client after you followed my tutorial, I wan't to see what other peoples look like... ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [center][b][size=18pt]Download TrigunScapes Client[/size][/b][/center]
[center]http://www.megaupload.com/?d=VXUUAXB0[/center] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [center][size=30pt]Credits[/size][/center]
[size=15pt][b]2% of the Credits go to Hamy Knight for his nooby tutorial, and making me want to make a better tutorial. 20% Goes to the maker of Project Satan. 20% Goes to the Moderator that decides not to lock this topic... 58% Goes to me for making the tutorial, and providing pictures, etc.[/b][/size] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

item.title: Editing A Client - To stop the questions
item.dc:creator: @Dazler09 Dazler09
item.description:
@Dazler09 wrote:

also there is another way you can do it bro…

Go into the client look for the background photo…
should be in with the run and compile area look for the photo and edit it in paint and save… should come up as ur background straight away.

but good help.

Read full topic
